shapes.label: Activity shape
shapes.comment: An activity is something that occurs over a period of time and acts upon or with entities; it may include consuming, processing, transforming, modifying, relocating, using, or generating entities.

property.name: Agent
property.description: An activity association is an assignment of responsibility to an agent or entity for an activity, indicating that the agent or entity had a role in the activity. The associated agent or entity should be identified by an IRI.

property.name: Generated
property.description: An entity identified by an IRI and that was generated by the current activity.

property.name: Used
property.description: An entity identified by an IRI and that was used in the current activity.

property.name: Was Started By
property.description: Start is when an activity is deemed to have been started by an entity, known as trigger. The activity did not exist before it starts. Any usage, generation, or invalidation involving an activity follows the activity's start. A start may refer to a trigger entity that set off the activity, or to an activity, known as starter, that generated the trigger.

property.name: Start Date
property.description: The activity start time. It should precede the value of prov:endedAtTime.
An activity qualified association allows to further specify the role and plan that an agent had.
An activity qualified usage allows to further specify the context of an entity usage: it's role, the time at which the usage started, why the entity is used,...

shapes.label: Usage shape
shapes.comment: Usage is the beginning of utilizing an entity by an activity. Before usage, the activity had not begun to utilize this entity and could not have been affected by the entity.

property.name: At time
property.description: The time at which the entity was used.

property.name: Role
property.description: A role is the function of an entity or agent with respect to an activity, in the context of a usage, generation, invalidation, association, start, and end.
